questions.uddipok:
Complete the sentences using suitable phrases/clauses:
(a) I bought a fiction of the Harry Potter series. The book was so captivating that ______. (b) He was too old ______. Yet, he did not listen to the warnings. (c) I met some of my school friends at the reunion. It was nearly ten years since ______. (d) Rupa has gained weight. It is high time she ______. Otherwise, she will become bulky. (e) The girl was all alone in the room. When I entered, she looked at me as though ______. (f) Cinderella suffered the cruelty of her step sisters. Had she had the courage to speak her mind, ______. (g) The woman bought some antique glasses. She carried them carefully lest they ______. (h) Our farmers are very hardworking. They work hard so that ______. (i) During exams, Article 144 is imposed in and around the exam hall. You cannot enter the exam hall unless ______. (j) Many of the politicians are corrupt. People hate them because ______.

sub_questions.explanation:
There is no fixed answer in this part , anything that matches the sentences with proper grammar is acceptable.
.
(a) I bought a fiction of the Harry Potter series. The book was so captivating that I couldn’t put it down until I finished it .
(b) He was too old to climb the mountain safely . Yet, he did not listen to the warnings.
(c) I met some of my school friends at the reunion. It was nearly ten years since we had last seen each other .
(d) Rupa has gained weight. It is high time she started dieting and exercising . Otherwise, she will become bulky.
(e) The girl was all alone in the room. When I entered, she looked at me as though she had seen a ghost .
(f) Cinderella suffered the cruelty of her step sisters. Had she had the courage to speak her mind, she would not have endured so much suffering .
(g) The woman bought some antique glasses. She carried them carefully lest they should break .
(h) Our farmers are very hardworking. They work hard so that they can provide food for the entire country .
(i) During exams, Article 144 is imposed in and around the exam hall. You cannot enter the exam hall unless you have a valid admit card .
(j) Many of the politicians are corrupt. People hate them because they misuse public money and betray the people's trust .

Journalist: Hello, Mrs. Sharif. I'm going to ask you a few questions today about how things used to be in the past. Firstly, how long have you been living in Dhaka?
Mrs. Sharif: Since my childhood. For more than forty-five years.
Journalist: That's a pretty long time indeed. Could you please tell us how people used to get water for their everyday use when you were a child?

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on "Your Most Intimate Childhood Friend" within 200 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
Your Most Intimate Childhood Friend
My most intimate childhood friend was Rafiq, whom I met when I was just five years old. We lived in the same neighborhood and attended the same school. From the very beginning, we shared a special bond built on trust, fun, and understanding. We spent countless hours playing together in the nearby park, riding bicycles, and exploring the fields around our homes. Rafiq was always kind, loyal, and ready to help me whenever I was in trouble. We studied together, shared our secrets, and supported each other through difficult times.
What made our friendship special was the way we could communicate without words — just a smile or a look was enough to understand each other. Even though we sometimes had small disagreements, they never lasted long because we valued our friendship deeply. Over the years, we grew up and went to different schools, but our bond remained strong. Rafiq taught me the true meaning of friendship — loyalty, honesty, and caring for each other. I am grateful for having such a wonderful friend during my childhood, and those memories will always stay close to my heart.

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph comparing and contrasting school life and college life within 200 words.

sub_questions.explanation:
Comparison Between School Life and College Life
School life and college life are two important phases in a student's journey, each with its own charm and challenges. School life is often more structured and disciplined. Students follow a fixed routine, wear uniforms, and are closely guided by teachers and parents. Friendships are usually deep and long-lasting, and the environment feels more like a second home. In contrast, college life offers greater freedom and responsibility. Students can choose their subjects, manage their own time, and are expected to be more independent. There is no fixed dress code, and the learning environment is more open and discussion-based. While school life focuses on basic education and discipline, college life prepares students for real-world experiences and career choices. However, both stages play a vital role in shaping a person’s character and future. School life gives the foundation, while college life builds on it with broader exposure and opportunities. Despite their differences, both phases create lasting memories and life lessons.
